From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin exigere, with normal change of conjugation to -ir. First attested in 1388.[1]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [əɡ.ziˈʒi]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [eɡ.ziˈd͡ʒiɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

exigir (first-person singular present exigeixo, first-person singular preterite exigí, past participle exigit)

  1. to demand

Conjugation

[edit]

Related terms

[edit]
  • exigència
  • exigent

References

[edit]
  1. ^ “exigir”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025

Further reading

[edit]
  • “exigir”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “exigir” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “exigir” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Occitan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin exigō.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Béarn):(file)
  • Audio (Languedoc):(file)

Verb

[edit]

exigir

  1. to demand

Related terms

[edit]
  • exigéncia
  • exigent

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin exigere.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /e.ziˈʒi(ʁ)/ [e.ziˈʒi(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /e.ziˈʒi(ʁ)/ [e.ziˈʒi(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /e.ziˈʒi(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /e.ziˈʒi(ʁ)/ [e.ziˈʒi(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /e.ziˈʒi(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /i.ziˈʒiɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /i.ziˈʒiɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /i.ziˈʒi.ɾi/

Verb

[edit]

exigir (first-person singular present exijo, first-person singular preterite exigi, past participle exigido)

  1. to require, need
  2. to ask, demand
    Synonym: demandar

Conjugation

[edit]

Related terms

[edit]

  • exigente

Further reading

[edit]

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin exigere.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /eɡsiˈxiɾ/ [eɣ̞.siˈxiɾ]
  • Rhymes: -iɾ
  • Syllabification: e‧xi‧gir

Verb

[edit]

exigir (first-person singular present exijo, first-person singular preterite exigí, past participle exigido)

  1. (transitive) to demand; to require; to call for
    Synonym: demandar
  2. (transitive) to exact
  3. (transitive) to hold (e.g., accountable)
  4. (reflexive) to be required, to be demanded

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of exigir (g-j alternation) (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive exigir
gerund exigiendo
past participle masculine feminine
singular exigido exigida
plural exigidos exigidas

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
